column2: Students should feel free to wear what they like.
People should not be forced to wear school uniforms. Each person has a choice of whether or not to wear school uniforms. I think principals should reconsider.

That style of argument degrades this forum and will cause the arguments to fall to the lowest common denominator. The word "indisputable", I do not think it means what you think it means. I disagree with your claim from personal experience, if nothing else, that makes it disputable. I think Yahoo! has chat rooms more attuned to your style of debate. Check them out.
I would not turn her in because she is my wife. She made a mistake, but we can get over it. If she trusted me by telling me what she did, then I could not do that to her.
I would not turn in my spouse. Just because my wife killed someone does not mean she is a terrible person.
I would choose books based on that, as television is terrible.
I love books and getting lost in them. They also improve your literature, so my English teacher said.
Reading a book allows you to save money because you do not need to buy any reading devices or use electricity.
I think that books are better than TV because they put you in a whole North World, and they are educational.

Books are enlightening. Books do not destroy children's morals. Books challenge the mind. Books take the reader to mystical places, paradise, and even the kitchen sink. Books change the perspective of life and often give the reader a sense of relativity. Television is like a drug.

India has strong military neighbors (China & Pakistan)...India has a bad relation with Pakistan due to territorial disputes and has fought four wars for this. As far as China is concerned, India's relationship with China has become tense due to the rise of territorial disputes and Indian interference in Pakistan. As for Pakistan, China has long term plans such as the Pak-China Economic Corridor and Gawadar Mega Oil City.
India is a horrible country.
India is a good adopter but a bad developer. The leader should be a great developer.
Russell Peters is very good at making fun of people.

According to a recent report 50% of scientists in NASA are Indian IITians. If those scientists joined ISRO, then our status, value, and astronomical knowledge of India would definitely increase. Now, think about IITians and students who are completing IIT. They are known to be superbrain. If India is capable of opening hitech institutions, then why are we unable to provide them a perfect job of their level? We are giving international status of education. Then why are we unable to take best advantages from them? This is due to brain drain, lack of industrial development, suitable working environment as well as proper salary. So, it is the need of the hour to improve our industrial sector.

I would rather be completely fatherless. I am not saying that not having a father is better than having a bad one. However, I do believe that you can grow up completely fatherless and without any major male role model and still be successful. Take me for example. I lived the first thirteen years of my life without a father or any fatherly interaction. Those were the essential times a kid needs to be around his father. I turned out great. So yes, as opposed to having a bad father that would rub off on me and mold me into half a man, I would rather be completely fatherless.
Although being fatherless is a horrible thing to deal with, I would rather be fatherless than have to deal with someone who constantly annoys me.
Raffles was followed by Farquhar when he visited Singapore, proving that he was the founder.
Raffles had written his discovery incorrectly as 29 February 1819. It was later corrected. He thought he had discovered Singapore on his first journey.
Without Raffles' vision and ambition, Singapore may have remained a sparsely inhabited island in the East Indies.

Raffles established a local magistrate in Singapore. This magistrate led to activities such as public gambling and slavery being controlled. Farquar protected Singapore from the Dutch attacks and attracted traders to Singapore while Raffles was away.

That is interesting because the burden of proof rests on you to prove that we are still evolving. I haven't noticed mankind changing form for a few thousand years. Another question- With this whole "big bang" theory, it seems like everything should have blown apart in a big bang and not come together.

As a nurse, I was in awe of the miracle of our bodies. Each cell is more complex than a computer. Do you question the existence of a creator, or do you require evidence that this highly organized machine was brought into existence by an accident or order of circumstances?
Although I voted for evolution, creation is more easily accepted due to the fact that someone somewhere had to change aspects of the universe in order for us to exist.
Believing in evolution as in Darwinism is like believing the puzzle can be solved by pouring out the pieces.
Firefox, and its extensions, consume large amounts of memory. For example, a session with three tabs and one week uses 250 MB of memory.

Physical education should be compulsory because it keeps us fit and healthy. If you really dislike sports, then you can quit when you are an adult, but when you are a child the best thing for you to do is study, play and exercise. If you prefer to be lazy, then you are most likely to get sick and unfit. Additionally, PE helps kids be better at teamwork.

In my opinion, a founder would be a leader who is well respected by the organization or group he is managing. Both Raffles and Farquhar were good leaders. However, when William Farquhar was sent off to Britain, more people went to send him off than the combined number of people that sent Raffles off during the three times he left Singapore. This shows that the people of Singapore respected Farquhar more than Raffles, and to them, he was a more competent leader.

The only other choices are adoption or keeping it. I know many children are adopted, but many are not. It might be better to just have an abortion to let them suffer. That is the chance they take, I guess. But who are we to decide one woman's pregnancy?
Who are we to judge what is right or wrong? Should we not simply let people make decisions and live with the consequences?

In fact, we are evolving. Research this: every generation, our small toe is becoming increasingly smaller. Eventually, we will end up losing it. I know it is a small, simple, seemingly useless appendage, but evolution is at work.

I understand that people have religious beliefs, and that's fine; I think people should be able to do what they want without being judged for every move they make. However, evolution has been scientifically proven to be correct. What is your point?
The answer is not because we are descended from monkeys, but because they are incapable of speech.
Pornography is not wrong. If it was, then it should be illegal. It provides the "erotic" needs of people who do not have a partner.
Pornography is not inherently wrong, because it can't substantially harm anyone who isn't involved in it by choice.
I think that they are all virgins or still live with their mothers and cannot watch pornography.

It is not wrong, and if you are talking about the actors doing the scene, it is their choice. They like doing it, and it is not degrading to women. We have freedom of expression, and it helps some of us to be open about sex.

There was a rapper who said he was the people's champ. When wanting to be successful, sometimes you need to worry about the common good because that is what people want. Personally, I believe advancing the common good is a better endeavor. Because when you are always thinking about yourself and your personal pursuits, you tend to become conceited and become a jerk. A jerk is someone who is not liked, and when alone and not liked by others, becomes lonely.

I believe there are different ways to feel happy and proud of what you do. For example, I feel happy helping others, but that does not mean I help every person in front of me. I try to do what I think is best and good in order to make somebody happy.

I believe common good is more important than personal pursuits because it is better to help other people. I feel good when I help people because it makes me feel happy that I am doing something good in my life.
This is a good thing, it shows that the school and everyone else accepts each other no matter where they come from, who they are, or what their religion is.
Wearing school uniforms makes you sure that you go to school to study, not show off your fashion sense.

Uniforms provide an equal and fair social status based on personality and not appearance. While I admit wearing what you want is fun and creative, it is only fun if everyone can do it. For some children, that is not the case and they cannot afford to live up to their peers standards. Uniforms would make social life much easier and would give a more mature look to the school.

The school uniform is a good idea because it makes pupils concentrate more on their education and not their clothes. I believe that school uniforms instill discipline among pupils. It makes pupils with different material statuses more equal.

I believe that having a father is better than not having one. A bad father is very bad, and he probably will not do all the things that a good father would do, but at least you have the assurance that you have someone who is a father in your life.

There is scientific evidence that shows having a mother and a father is the best way for a child to progress physically and mentally. Therefore, a bad father is better than none. Additionally, people change. There are family therapy sessions you can attend to help.

I believe that people are able to change. I would rather have the hope that my father could have been a good father, than know that I will never meet him. I would be too curious as to what kind of father he could have been.
Atlas would drop the world for a chance to shake his hand.

The growth in bottled water production has resulted in water extraction in areas near bottling plants, which affects nearby consumers and farmers. Additionally, two gallons of water are wasted for every gallon of water that goes into the bottles.
Water bottles can be made into fiber materials such as clothing or carpet. It is easy to simply fill a cup with water and re-use it.
TV is much more enjoyable than reading books from the past.
Television is superior to reading.
I love television so much that I can watch whatever I want. You can watch DVDs and play on PlayStations.
Most Americans recycle more than half of their bottle waters. Stop complaining that we do not recycle because we do! http://www.treehugger.com/culture/23-percent-of-americans-donatmt-recycle.html
Without plastic water bottles, there is only darkness everyday.
Until we get out of this recession, we will not be able to ban water bottles.

This idea is essentially playing with semantics. I did not propose that there be a separate but identical marriage for homosexual relationships, or that it be called "civil unions." This is the type of reasoning that the slippery slope argument applies perfectly to. Why not let any small group demand a change with minimal relative impact? I'm not arguing that law shouldn't change. I'm arguing that law developed under one set of assumptions should be blindly applied to a different scenario. Read my rebuttal to res0ndf7 for more on this line.
Gay marriage is not a thing. Marriage is between a man and a woman.

I am an American and I am ashamed to admit "Merica is rich due to slavery." India never had slavery and was once rich, until the British came and took everything away. India was left in a bad state, but started developing quickly. India is much more competitive in education than America and soon when everyone has education, India will excel. India has the potential.

India is a secular state. People from all communities reside here. India has knowledge of almost all countries and the way they live. It can easily lead all the people of the world without creating any nuissance among anyone.
Indians have the potential to lead the world.
I say no because spanking does not really solve the problem. People can get over a spanking quickly and then do whatever they did before. It is better to be strict than to abuse a kid.

It depends on the severity of the kill. For example, if I knew it was done maliciously instead of in self defense, or to defend his family or belongings, I would likely leave and want nothing to do with it.
I would say that I would turn them in, because I do not think that is right, killing someone and getting away with it. Also, I would not want to be next to a murderer in my bed.

I would definitely turn them in, even if it bothers me. If a person commits a murder, they should not get away with it. It is dangerous to have them around. Also, if I do not turn her in, then I may become a victim in the future.

The government does have the right to tell women what they can and cannot do with their bodies. For example, a woman cannot legally prostitute herself in many states. She cannot take drugs into her body. She cannot murder others. She cannot steal. She cannot display her naked body in public. There are many more. Men can also not do these things.
I am pro-life, and here is a question for those who are pro-choice: Is the fetus in the mother's stomach alive? If not, how do you know?
In Nebraska, it is legal to have an abortion by killing the fetus as it is coming out of the womb.

There should be no argument about this. Regardless of how you view a fetus, it is still a living form that has been created intimately. You should not be changing what mothernature, God, fate, or whatever has decided for you. If you did not want to get pregnant in the first place, then do not have sex or use protection. Yes, there are some women that get raped and it is unfortunate, but they should give the child up for adoption. It is not the child's fault that it was created. So why should the raping being have to pay the ultimate price of its life?

There are many ways to avoid becoming pregnant, condoms are effective for both men and women, morning-after pills are effective for both men and women, the patch, pill, and other forms of birth control. It is the woman's fault that she did not use any of these. Perhaps instead of being pro-choice, they should be pro-life with exceptions such as those who are raped. This would ensure that all parties are treated equally.

If a woman is raped, that is a valid argument. However, why would you punish an innocent baby with the death penalty for some other man's crime? If the woman does not want the child she could give it up for adoption. I simply do not understand why you would kill the baby. The emotional trauma would happen regardless of whether or not the child is killed.

I believe that homosexual marriage should be allowed. Many people who do not support it do not like homosexuality at all. If two people are happy together, love each other, and want to be together forever, why should they not be allowed to marry?

The Bible is not the origin of marriage. Marriage is found in almost every society, including those that were never touched by Christianity or Judaism. The Bible can only be argued to be the origin of Christian marriage.
You cannot choose someone's lifestyle because you do not agree with it. You cannot call someone's lifestyle a "choice" when you are not that person.

If you do not like gay marriage, then do not watch a gay couple kiss. You are not obligated to tell people that their views are incorrect and that they must change their feelings. In the meantime, everyone is entitled to their opinions, but keep them to themselves. Do not try to change others based on your beliefs. It is selfish and takes away self rights.

In my opinion, personal pursuits are more important than helping others. While it may seem selfish, once you become good at what you do, you can help others do the same. Therefore, you are helping yourself and also helping others.

Politics is very useful to people. The nation we live in exists because it is built around laws and values the people support. Without police I would be afraid to go outside without a gun. Think more theoretically. Why don't terrorists blow up every city here? Are you frisked every time you leave your house? No. Politics is the governing body that has developed public safety. Arguments happen so people can learn to understand one another and learn. It is okay to debate. You don't have to always be right but take time to learn. It is the media that destroys people, not politics.

First, I hate Bush. Second, I hate the Christian ethos that he is trying to push on the country. Third, I am a pagan, so I am not a Christian. Fourth, I am bisexual, and have had sex with men, therefore I am a threat.

It is as old as known history. The earliest civilizations practiced it back even in Mesopotamia, which is older than Egypt. I wonder how many blacks in America would be willing to go back in time and stop the importation of their ancestors. Africa has aids, drought, pestilence, civil wars, ethnic genocide, and no economy. America sounds pretty good after all!

If you want to maintain contact with your children, then you need to act as a father. California is fairly equitable when it comes to fathers. Your children have legal rights to have contact with you, unless you are found unfit. Do you have a court order? You need to find an attorney within the jurisdiction of the last court order. Good luck!

I am not a lawyer, but here is what I can tell you. "You may not exercise any of the rights granted to You in Section 3 above in any manner that is primarily intended for or directed toward commercial advantage or private monetary compensation." The definition of "commercial advantage" is somewhat vague, but if you are not making more money than it costs to run the site, etc. (factoring in non-cash costs like your time as well), you are likely acting within the license. Making money is not completely forbidden by the license, but using the work primarily to do so.

No, that is the beauty of the United States of America; you have no health care. Why would it change if you had to go to jail while the rest of the public pays their hard earned money into taxes? Perhaps if your brother had contributed to society instead of committing crimes, he would not be in this situation. Jail has no company benefits.

Yes, if you execute a murderer, he will never escape, he will never hurt anyone else, and it helps the victim's family heal. The thought that a murderer is still alive disgusts the victims' families. There is something intrinsically just about executing a murderer, because the victim will never have another birthday or holiday with their families. Some crimes are so vile that the only punishment can be death.

Skating is not illegal, but skating in certain public places is. For example, when I worked at a store, kids skated on our sidewalk and almost killed some of our elderly customers. That is why it is illegal in certain places, because you could run over people who are just walking around.
Would you like the government to outlaw unpopular thought? How long will it take you to formulate an unpopular belief? Are you prepared to go to jail for your beliefs?

If you are the father, you can simply give extra money that does not go through the courthouse. Otherwise, you can request a review. It takes awhile to complete, but child support offices go to the employer and verify all of the income, and then reevaluates the amount per month owed. Some states give cost of living increases every year, but some don't. Don't listen to people who tell you that you should be able to support the child on your own. You did not get pregnant on your own, and you certainly shouldn't have to support that child on your own.
I agree that unless there is something in it for us, it is difficult to convince the US to send troops to police the world. However, when we do, I applaud it.

If you are connected to city sewers, you have to pay. Check with your city councilman. They probably negotiated a billing delay when they were first installed. Even if it was a city oversight. It is a service you have to pay for. They charged me extra sewer when I filled my pool, 6000 gallons worth, even though it didn't go down the drain. If they can charge you, they will. Especially if all your neighbors are connected, they don't give you a choice.

Most states do not have laws addressing minimum ages to babysit or minimum ages children can be left alone. Unless someone can cite a specific Illinois law, answers here are of little value. While 15 or 16 might sound like logical numbers, that does not mean the answers are correct on the law. I do not know Illinois law nor am I going to make up some number for you.

In a free society, there is no such thing as the "right" to not be subjected to offensive things. If you read the newspaper, browse the internet, watch TV, etc. you will be offended. You do have the right to protest peacefully, picket, etc.
I feel that this is totally against everything that is American.

I would say not all foreigners, but it would depend on which country they are from. The entire world has favorites and dislikes. I think the non-favorites for countries already know who they are and why. If a nation is violent and not good for the world, and the government lies, steals, and kills innocent humans, then it is not well liked. Neither is the people, because the government is supposed to represent the people. Therefore, it is the government that causes it and their people pay for it.

The United States needs a national driver's license. A standard driver's license will make the country safer against terrorists. Many of the September 11, 2001 terrorists had driver's licenses that they would not have been able to obtain under the stringent requirements you are putting in your bill. The bill requires proof of citizenship, at least a minimal skill with the English language, and proof of address. The bill will be granted and regulated by the Department of Homeland Security. The program will be funded by the fees paid by the drivers, so it will not need tax revenues. It will actually remove a burden from the states.

Is it correct to say that Che Guevara, the Cuban revolutionary leader, once wrote "you can kill a man, but you cannot kill an idea"? In his writing, he was expressing the idea that freedom from oppression is spreading regardless of attempts to eradicate it. There is still oppression in the world, and there is a thirst for freedom from it, so why not? The same basic conditions apply as when Che was alive.

In a way you are making an interesting point. However, I would challenge you to think about this question from another angle. In my opinion, faith can and should inform public policy. In a republic such as ours, we have agreed to abide by the majority, until a new majority comes into being.

The court must overturn the conviction. Expungement of the records is another matter that requires more legal work. Even if that were to be granted, there is always a paper trail. It is practically impossible to get rid of all of the record, even with a court order.
If my neighbor smokes marijuana, it does not harm me, break my leg, or infringe on my rights. Therefore, it is not the government's responsibility to tell me what to do.

You are not racist for wanting your family to have equal rights as others. In fact, you should have more rights if you were born and raised in the country. Unfortunately, here in Britain that is not the case. We actually have less rights and receive less benefits if we become unemployed or sick as opposed to immigrants who get much more of our money that we worked for which they take.

Your crime does not fit under discrimination, as you committed that crime. That was a choice, unlike race, gender, etc... I do not think that everyone will turn you down, but I typically look at the crime when hiring. There are a lot more people out there with records than you would guess. If someone was a thief or violent, I will not hire them. Companies can refuse to hire for ANY reason. It may just be that here in Michigan the economy is so bad, and unemployment is so rampant, that there just aren't enough job openings. But, I would be honest about yourself, if they are asking.

Hate Crime laws penalize people more severely for their opinions than for their actions. For example, if someone kills another person because they hate that person's ethnicity or religious views, they will receive a harsher punishment than another guy who kills without hate, simply because he enjoys killing. The point is, you may be entitled to your own opinion, but you will be punished for your thoughts and not just the act.

Sandytoes, asking a court clerk will do no good because they are not permitted to give legal advice. That said, why don't you give us more details about the judgement. What was it for, when was it perfected, why you say that it is expired. What state do you live in? In California, for instance, judgements expire after 10 years. If the judgment has expired, it is probably not affecting your credit whatsoever. The only way to actually get it off your credit report is to petition the court to have it expunged, but chances are real slim on that. Otherwise, you're probably just going to have to deal with it being there.

I think you have a case. Did you happen to take pictures of all of the "repairs"? Sometimes the threat of small claims court will get them to write a check. You may have to pay a lawyer to write up the court documents, unless the clerk is willing to help you out. You did agree to the repairs, but you could argue that you expected them to be close to the original quality. The fact that they tried to repair the stand indicates they insured the UNIT part also. Good luck.

Regardless of whether the police are there to protect you, if you have a person break into your house at night, you may not have time to call the police. Even if you do, and they are only five minutes away, you can be killed a hundred times over in five minutes. You have a right and a duty to defend yourself.

I think prostitution is overrated. If people want to have sex and get paid, then they are not. A woman can have sex with many men and get nothing. But if the men throw her a few dollars, she is a prostitute. Why? Why give it up for free. My opinion is if a guy friend of mine wants to have sex with me and my light bill is due, and I do not have it, then why not, get the bill paid and feel good while doing it.
We need to close our borders until we are able to take care of our own.

There are many types of abuse; mental, physical, neglect, etc. Perhaps she does not want you around anymore. A restraining order may provide some peace of mind, "If he is not around me, he cannot hurt me anymore." It may provide a safe area for the heart to rest easier.

First of all, cops do not piss you off. You choose to be. It's called a victim mentality. You own your emotions, no one else. Secondly, since I am a cop, I can say this much... I remove skaters from areas that are posted with no skateboarding signs, where vandalism is a common occurrence or where there are trespass warnings. I do not, nor do I know any other officers, set out to "piss" people off. It is merely enforcing the laws that are applied upon them. You may not be a problem, but the two dozen other skateboarders before you might have been.

To an extent, what is commonly referred to as racial profiling is justified when it is not abused. For example, a car load of black or Hispanic kids are rolling around an upscale neighborhood at 3 am. Plates are run, and it is pretty obvious they do not live in the area and may be up to no good. I will say the same for a car load of suburban white boys driving around in high drug areas. That, contrary to popular belief, is also profiling. Crime needs to be controlled, and I do not personally see it as a violation of one's right's to be stopped when they are deemed to be suspicous.

You are mistaken, they have not been shut down in India. The ban is only in Maharastra. The government had received many complaints from women about their husbands wasting money on these bars and not looking after their families. Also, many criminal activities took place at these bars. You may be aware of the Tarannum and Telgi cases where Tarannum's monthly income was approximately 1 lac and Telgi would throw away approximately 1 lac per day on the bar girls. To put a stop on these criminal activities the Government of Maharastra had put a ban on these ladies bars.
The Lakota nation has contributed to the land by planting trees that were not on the continent at the time of Columbus's arrival. We grow most of the food we need to survive.

While some judges can be bought, they aren't even the real problem. The philosophy for being a judge is to have no political affiliation, to be fair and impartial, to listen to the merits of each case separately and as presented. However, some judges, especially a couple of new Supreme Court Justices, do not feel the need to represent the law. Worse than one crooked judge in a million, is the zealot who believes it is his or her responsibility to "fix" what he or she believes is wrong in the world.

I do not believe that a man should have a say on whether a woman should have an abortion or not. I simply believe that, following a woman's decision to become a parent, a man should the have legal right to abstain from parenthood (the exact same option extended to said woman).
I am interested in hearing other views on this. If it matters, I am Christian, 16 years old, and male.

I do not understand how the adversarial judicial system helps to get at the truth. It seems more about how well an argument is presented than the facts of a case. Additionally, the jury, who are basically untrained (in terms of weighing evidence), decide which argument is better. What are the arguments in favor of this system?

I hate to be a downer, but I do not think humanity has another century left. I am not talking about human extinction. We will probably survive whatever happens to some degree. I am talking about society collapse. Humans may still be around, but in a Mad Max/The Road/Book of Eli type of existence.

For the international CMVs, the term "greece" refers to a social component of my university that throws parties every weekend. Each party has a theme and dress code. While some may argue that this is okay in a fun and humorous way, I believe that organizing parties with dress codes that allow people to dress up as racial stereotypes should be frowned upon and ultimately banned. By allowing these parties to continue as a college community, we are furthering the segregation, discrimination, and undermining of our international cultures.
I believe that the Wilhelm scream is too widely recognized and should not be used anymore without the audience acknowledging it.

For instance, prostitution stings and drug deal stings should be illegal. Anything that does not have a victim and does not cause harm to anyone is okay. However, setting people up for these crimes seems as if the police are shopping for criminals to take in. Baiting and reeling them in is often times a bad idea.

The title is self-explanatory. Vladimir Putin is the head of a disappointed ex-empire, willing to gain its former glory. The Russian people are traditionally obedient, willing to submit to an autocratic will, and ready to devote itself to general patriotic ideals (i.e. getting new territories). The guy seems very determined not to comply with Western moral and political values, and seems defiant to the present unanimity of attitudes against his latest moves. It is already quite obvious that Russia's stances in international politics is not a democratically generated one, but exclusively owed to Putin's will. He likes war, confrontation, and seems indifferent to the human costs of his actions. He is determined to make history by any means, just like the celebrity killers do their crimes to get unforgettable, no matter how.

I will try to keep this short and sweet. The race car is the better vehicle on all maps except the moon. The downside of the bike is that it is very flippy. If you get onto a hill and lose momentum you end up doing a back flip and then you slip backwards and can't get back up without a run up. The race car, once you gain forward momentum the downforce keeps your front end down and you will get up any hill.

We are greedy and would remove it if it was useless. Secondly, it is evolving. You have seen new security measures every year and while they are annoying, they may have potentially saved your life. How's that for throwing away 500ml of water and standing in queue for 30min? I can see that many people in reddit disagree with this, however, and I want to know why so I can form a balanced opinion. So CMV!

I believe that a man's first love is his strongest love, and every following love is a bit less intense than the first love. This is similar to trying to match the intensity of the first love. After separating from your first love, your naive beliefs about love go away, and you start to see how hurtful love can be. Reddit changed my view.

The recent events surrounding Michael Jackson's death, which I believe was not truly accidental, have made me reflect on how his death erased most, if not all, of the bad he had done in the public conscience. This seems to be the general rule for people who die young, from JFK to Tupac. However, outside of the "never speak ill of the dead" adage, I can't understand why humanity keeps deifying the prematurely dead.

I fundamentally disagree that every individual has a right to live. If you are willing to put someone else's right to life in jeopardy, then you have demonstrated that you are a net negative impact to society, and that as a whole we would all be better off if you were dead.

I am not speaking about my parents here. They are wonderful people. I meant grandparents, cousins, uncles, aunts, etc. (Not brothers / sisters either, I am an only child.) Most of my parents' argument is that my family won't be around forever, and that they would do anything for me. The thing is, I don't care that they would do anything for me. It is similar to having some random almost-stranger say they would do anything for you. Just because said random stranger would do anything for me does not mean I like them or need to care about them. I do not want them to help me. I do not need them to help me. They expect me to love this random stranger because this random stranger would do things for me. This random stranger means nothing to me and I find them annoying and rude.
Requiring ID is a useless and inconvenient policy. I can understand why they would have it, but even following basic rational thought it doesn't make sense.

I believe John Hammond had a great vision, but he was underpaid by his HR department. The park would boost the economy of the Dominican Republic, as well as any other nation where it is opened. It would encourage kids to pursue science. The possibilities are endless. As long as we

Video games should be treated like a drug. Millions of lives are affected because people do not monitor their usage or do not use them in moderation. Especially children who are becoming consumed and obsessed, it takes over their lives and social skills. It is so sad. Incumbents have an advantage of being able to grant political favors immediately, better financing, gerrymandering, and name recognition, so challengers need a boost to make it fair. This would cause higher turnover, which would be good. This would reduce the corrupting influence of non quid pro quo contributions by making it more uncertain how long the purchased influence would last. High turnover of representatives would disrupt the habits that form which serve their interests over the people's, such as proposing the most contentious bills to wring money out of lobbyists. When a majority of representatives are freshmen, they will be more idealistic and less jaded, and this will help them serve the public good. I'm not sure how the best way to implement it is, but maybe just decrease incumbent's vote tally by 15% or so. My view is that something like this *should* be done, not that it's likely under present circumstances.

The first time I visited this location, I ordered a latte and was pleased with it. The second time I visited, I grabbed a hot tea and a yogurt parfait. I watched the woman in her underwear walk to the back to make it. She washed her hands before she got started but I was already over it. I did not plan on eating anything but politely waited. The yogurt parfait was a pretty fancy yogurt option after the long wait. Health code standards have gone out the window in the valley.

The ambiance was good, but the food was not very good. I had the gnocchi pesto which was very bland. I did not taste any basil, olive oil, or parmesan. I am not sure how that is possible. The pine nuts were just sprinkled on top which seemed lazy. The salad was brown and the house Italian tasted like stale parm. The portions were not very large for the price. I will return in the summer to check out "the most romantic patio in Cleveland." I hope that another dish will be worth it.

The American Disabilities Act prevents an employer from viewing an emergency psychiatric evaluation, and you have the right to sue if it is used against you. You need to make your employer aware of your condition, and if they fire you, you will file a claim with the ADA. Chances are they will deny your claim if you did not make them aware of your illness prior to employment. After the ADA reviews this, you will be given a "right to sue" letter. After the ADA reviews this, you can get a lawyer involved, who will argue that you did not make your employer aware of your illness prior to employment because they would have not hired you in the first place. Bottom line, mental illnesses such as bipolar are a disabilty. Additionally, you may also be eligible for Social Security.

After a marriage ends, unless a prenup is signed, one partner usually receives alimony from the other. I think this is wrong, and selfish of the people who receive it. Obviously if they had kids together the partner should send the person the kids are mostly with child support to help take care of the children, but money just to take care of the adult they didn't want to be with anymore? hell no. Although eBay serves only as a marketplace connecting suppliers and consumers, it is better from an economic perspective. With no firmly set prices, eBay's market closely resembles an internet-based free market, where consumers pay the prices they are willing to pay and suppliers supply goods for what they are willing to supply them for. This is a self-targeting market which operates (with the exception of delivery problems) at optimum efficiency.

The scientific rigor you mention is not present in evolutionary theory. For example, in the 1800s, Charles Lyell and others came up with dates for rock strata. To say that this proves the dates that Lyell came up with is a logical fallacy, and it sure doesn't sound like true scientific rigor to me.

The vast majority of the answers above make the same mistake that the question implies. It is not the free exercise clause that deals with discrimination against gays. The issue is the Establishment clause: "Congress shall make no law respecting the establishment of religion..." As interpreted, that basically means that religious reasons cannot be used to justify secular laws. Those who try to use the Bible (or any other moral justifications) to discriminate against gays seem to think that they can use their religion to make laws, because they are in the majority. Just as long as nobody else bases any legal actions on a different religion. It is pure hypocrisy and pure religious-based discrimination. And while people are certainly entitled to either on a personal level, they cannot do so as a matter of law.

I live nearby and was recommended this place by some Arsenal workers. The food is made from scratch and is very good. The place is never busy and you can enjoy your meal while looking out the windows at Penn Avenue.

Raffles had a vision for Singapore that it would be orderly, elegant, rational, and modern. However, while he was gone, Farquhar developed Singapore poorly, causing Raffles to feel dissappointed.

Although Farquhar was said to be the one who stayed in Singapore to support its development, Raffles provided the planning, the strategizing, and was the one to select Singapore as another British base. If William Farquhar was to be proclaimed the founder because he did the "grunt work", then perhaps the supervisor of a construction site should get the most commission, instead of the contractor? Besides, Raffles left Singapore under the orders of his superiors, and he did not leave of free will.

Raffles was the one to sign the treaty with the Temenggong and Sultan Hussien. William Farquhar was the one to remain in Singapore and develop it further, but Raffles was the one who gave him the position because he had to leave and return to Bencoolen. In addition, he was the one who laid out the foundation of Singapore's development, so he should be considered a founder.
Raffles Institution, which is now known as Raffles Institution, was established in 1837.

Raffles conceived a town plan to remodel Singapore into a modern city. The plan included separate areas for different ethnic groups and provided other facilities such as roads, schools, and lands for government buildings. In October 1822, a Town Plan Committee was formed by Raffles to oversee the project.
Raffles found Farquhar had done a poor job of raising the city of Singapore. He introduced opium sales into Singapore in order to raise more money for Singapore.

Bottled water is not subject to the same regulations as tap water, so you are not sure of what you are drinking when you drink bottled water.

I feel that the consumption of water bottles should not be allowed unless in an emergency. Plastic bottles can leach chemicals after a time, and they end up in landfills. Furthermore, they take 700 years to start to decompose. 90% of the cost is the water bottle itself. Additionally, nearly one in five tested water bottles have bacteria.

Over 1.5 million barrels of oil were used to make the plastic bottles consumed in the US last year. That does not include the petroleum used to transport them. That is enough petroleum to power 100,000 automobiles for a year.

The transportation of bottled water from western Europe into New York City alone released an estimated 3,800 tons of global warming pollution into the atmosphere. Additionally, in California, 18 million gallons of bottled water were shipped in from Fiji in 2006, releasing an estimated 2,500 tons of global warming pollution.
If you do not save bottled water for an emergency, you are thinking about the present. You are drinking bottled water when you do not need to.

The primary shortcoming in any public opinion poll is that there is a tendency toward bias at every stage of the questioning process. The person asking the questions has his bias; a person who wrote the question has her bias; a person who is answering the question has her bias. The first two forms of bias should ideally not show up in the results of an ethically conducted poll, however they often do. The next most important shortcoming is that while ideally the sample set is big enough and diverse enough to represent the general population, commonly small and/or homogeneous samples are used to save money or time or both. Sometimes small and/or homogeneous samples are used by unethical poll takers to influence the outcome of their poll.

Is it "unfair dismissal"? In most states, employment is at-will, so an employer can fire an employee at any time for any reason or no reason at all. However, there are restrictions. For example, employees cannot be fired because they are a member of a protected class (i.e. age, race, gender, disability). They cannot be fired, for example, if they were whisleblowers in most states. SEEK ATTORNEY ADVICE to see if you have an employment discrimination or unlawful termination claim. Most plaintiffs' lawyers who handle employment work will have an initial consultation with you for free and will take your case on a "Contigency" so you do not have to pay for legal fees unless you win your case. Contact your local bar association for a reference.

The actual leaders of bailed-out firms should be killed by lethal injection, not figureheads or sacrificial lambs. It should not be too hard to figure out who called the shots, even if they've since quit. The moral hazard created by bailouts is that business leaders get to keep the profits while the costs of a crash are borne by the public. That encourages them to take big risks at our expense. Adding the personal risk of death should correct this problem. This would also help balance out inequity in the application of the law. Right now the sword of justice comes down on the poor more than the rich. I don't like the death penalty in general because I don't think it works as a deterrent; people who commit foolish crimes aren't foresightful enough to be thinking about the consequences. But corporate leaders probably ARE. They will think twice before sinking the airship and bailing out with a golden parachute, because they will land on Lady Liberty's sword.

There are hundreds of states on the planet and all of them engage extensively in initiating aggression against the individuals they control. Sometimes this aggression is in response to violence initiated by individuals and can be justified. For example, imprisoning a murderer. However, most of the time, it is the state that initiates the aggression. We invent euphemisms to give state action legitimacy. For example, we say "drafted" when we could say "slave soldier." Or, "drug confiscation" when we could say "theft of herbs." These euphemisms muddie the emotions people feel when they encounter these situations. One day, people will look at our society run by politicians using violence, and it will be as incomprehensible to them as the Spanish Inquisition is to us.

From a physical and chemical perspective, neurons are fired when we see, smell, hear, touch, and taste things. Those neurons interact with other neurons via chemical processes that are well understood. Eventually, motor neurons are triggered which cause us to respond to the sensory input. In no part of this process can I see a way to affect the chain reaction of neurons in any way. Sure, each of our brains is put together differently, which means that each of us will respond differently to similar stimuli. But given the exact same situation, our brains will react exactly the same way to the exact same stimuli every time.

I would support the decriminalization of marijuana, as long as it is still illegal to sell or advertise it to minors, and it is not used while operating automobiles or heavy machinery. There are several benefits to legalizing marijuana: First, people who were arrested for using marijuana would be given a second chance to re-enter the workforce. Second, due to the fact that there will be fewer prisoners, the taxpayers will pay less to upkeep the prison system. Third, federal and state governments will gain revenue by taxing marijuana as all goods and services are taxed. Keeping marijuana illegal indirectly reduces the supply of it, but does not reduce the demand. As a result, the value of marijuana increases and the drug industry finds profit in selling it illegally on the black market.

It is safer than alcohol, nearly impossible to overdose on, and if it was legal, it would be easier to regulate. A good example of this would be prohibition: when it was illegal, people still did it (as they do with weed), and it cost a lot of police force to crack down on speakeasies (like they do with weed houses), which could have been used to solve more pressing cases like who shot Mr. Burns and who took the last donut. When prohibition was removed, organization returned to society.

You have the right to ask for sole custody if you feel that he is causing your daughter more harm than good. This can be difficult to prove, especially if there has never been a court order as far as visitation is concerned. If he does not follow the visitation times, the judge will presume that he is giving up his parental rights and could order you sole custody. This may take some time. As far as child support is concerned, he will be subject to back child support from the day your daughter is born unless he can prove that he was paying. You would do both of these by going to your county child support services office and filing child support payment/custody documents. It is not hard to fill out and they will assist you in doing them. The more information you have about your daughter's father the better, i.e. job information, social security, drivers license, address, etc.

I am not sure what your question is about. Petitions are legal. You can make a petition concerning almost anything, and get a lot of people willing to sign it via email or otherwise. However, a petition is not a legal document. It is merely an attempt to get a certain number of people to act in favor of a particular issue. For example, you can make a petition in favor of banning smoking, but just because you get a bunch of people to sign it, that does not mean that smoking will be banned. However, if a legislator gets enough petitions all saying the same thing, he/she might want to do it if it is in his/her best political interest to do so.

A person listed as "payable on death" has no interest in your account while you are still alive. They will only get any assets left when you die, they are not on the hook for any liabilities -- certainly not while you're alive. Let them know you will get a lawyer if they do not change their tune -- and that it will cost them more than $800. Bank stealing money from innocent children? Is this your assignment to argue that retribution is socially cohesive, or did you come up with this yourself? Retributive justice is based on the idea that criminals should be punished for undermining social "harmony" or "balance." Therefore, we cannot dole out retributive punishment before we first have a definition of what is social harmony or balance. The process of defining social harmony and balance is socially cohesive because, to some extent, we must generally agree on what the definition of social order is. In other words, the process of accepting and agreeing on laws, customs, or religion is socially cohesive.

The first step is to determine how much sugar is in an 8 ounce glass of Arizona Iced Tea, Coca-Cola Classic, and Pepsi. Then, we compare the first two ingredients of each drink: water and high fructose corn syrup. Then, we determine that Arizona gets its flavor mostly from tea leaves while Coke gets its flavor from flavoring. Then, we determine that they both stain teeth; Coke has caramel color while Arizona gets its color from tea leaves. I like both drinks, but I feel that they are both pretty terrible at this point and that they should only be used sparingly.

I do not believe there are any victimless crimes. In fact, some laws are enacted because they seem to do no harm to an individual, group, or society as a whole. However, you need to consider the full effect of the action to determine if there is harm to society. For example, prostitution should probably be legalized and regulated, but some aspects, such as working on a street corner, cause harm to a neighborhood, and should remain illegal. No, you still have to pay your rent. However, if the landlord does not make the repair, the tenant can do any of the following: Take the rent when it is due to the local clerk of courts. A tenant must be current in their rent with the clerk of courts. Apply to the court to order the landlord to make the repairs. The court can also lower the rent until the repairs are made or give the tenant some of the rent money so the tenant can have the repairs made. End the lease. Cancel the rental agreement and move. This can be done only after the tenant has given appropriate notice, and the landlord has failed to correct the condition.

Before hiring an attorney, consider contacting the business and informing them of the incident and asking for their insurance company's name. Often they make reasonable offers, such as a doctor bill plus $1,000. If they refuse, then you should consider discussing the matter with an attorney. If you are not injured and received treatment, your case is weak. Damages for pain and suffering will be approximately $1,000 unless you can prove the incident was the result of negligence or malice. I feel that concepts of right and evil are man made and subjective. Because of this, there are no objective morals and true 'good' and 'evil' don't exist. I do not think you can make a statistical argument for the existence of aliens when you only have one example of a planet with life. If you had two examples in the Milky Way galaxy, for example, we could conclude that life probably evolves at least twice per galaxy. Or if we had an example from the nearest star with planets, we could conclude that probably every star with planets evolves life. But with just a single example, how do you possibly use that to estimate the distribution of life in the universe? It could be once per universe, once per galaxy, or once per 100 stars. It would look the same.

Most people, rather than form an unbiased opinion about a certain issue, actually form their position due to emotional reasons. I went deep sea fishing last weekend. We caught about ten to fifteen fish. We first caught a lot of bait fish -- live fish which we caught the night before -- then later jammed a giant hook through their still live bodies and threw them in the water. I cannot find any reason to justify this behavior as a moral human being. The bait fish suffered badly when caught, suffered more when we jammed a hook through their face, and suffered even more as they were stalked by larger fish and the suffering then ended when they were eaten. At which point the other fish suffered with a hook through their face, fought for their lives as I dragged them to the surface, then removed the hook and started over. I did not like it. Fishers, do you change my mind?

If you hold religious beliefs and promote them as absolute truth, you need proof to validate your claim. If you refuse to give your fellow man this proof, you're hiding the truth from him. You hinder his or her ability to encounter the truth, and quite frankly, if he or she was to die thereafter and was condemned for eternity, isn't your blood on your hands? You had the means to save them but didn't.

Evolution is backed by science including DNA tracing and archaeological findings such as Lucy. Evolution simply states that species can evolve in order to adapt to their environment. Humans have most likely evolved from apes, because their DNA is very similar and they have some of the same behavioral patterns as us. While evolution is a scientific theory, it is not what the average use of the term means. Most people say theory about things that haven't been proven yet and there is much doubt. This is not the case. A scientific theory can only become fact when absolutely everything is discovered about it. Gravity is only a scientific theory, but it is largely believed to be true. Therefore, we can say that evolution is more credible a theory than creationism.

My date and I had a wonderful experience here. My date loved the prime Rib and her mashed potatoes. My burger was cooked to perfection. The only downside was the Mac and cheese. I spoke with the manager and he said that it was a new item and they were working on it. We will definitely be back.

The atmosphere is very cool, as if you are in a wooden cabin. It fits in excellent with the Canadian theme. I have had a few dishes here, the lobster roll, PEI mussels, and boneless back rib burger, all of which I would recommend. The daily noodle is scarce, however, I have missed it on all three visits.

We went in on a Monday night. There were several servers there, however, none came to take our drink order for 15 minutes. The manager asked how we were doing, but he continued walking. Why ask how I am doing when you clearly do not care or want to know why, which is evidenced by your pace around the restaurant.

The food was amazing and our server Samantha was very nice. However, it took the hostess a while to notice us and when she went to seat us she ran to the table leaving us running after her to catch up. Also, I think Samantha may have given herself an extra $3 tip on our card charge. Our bill was $47 and some change, I left a $10 cash tip. When I looked at my bank account I had a $50 charge. I would have gone back and questioned it, but we did not keep our receipt, so there was no way to prove it.
I tried two curries and pad Thai and gave it five stars because the waiter made a new dish with less spice.

I had a bad experience here. The place was not busy, but the staff was overworked. The food was not very good and the mushroom stroganoff was inedible. We had a group of 12 people and the patio was not very enjoyable.
I was extremely disappointed in the food portions for the price point. Perhaps I am just bitter that this place took over Messinis. I gave 1 star because I had high expectations and it failed.
